metadata.Title: CVE-2023-32247 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the handling ofSMB2_SESSION_SETUP commands. The issue results from the lack of control ofresource consumption. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to createa denial-of-service condition on the system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
